summary: Feature request to support OpenTelemetry v2 and newer library versions (0.200.0+). The SDK currently only supports OTel v1, and upgrading would be a breaking change for existing users.
userImpact: Users wanting to use OpenTelemetry v2 cannot upgrade due to SDK not supporting the newer major version.
rootCause: OTel v2 represents a breaking change that cannot be implemented in the existing v1 package without breaking existing setups.
proposedFix: Create a new package (e.g., @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry2) that supports OTel v2 while maintaining v1 compatibility. Implementation roadmap: (1) Complete OTel v1 event coverage improvements, (2) Extend v1 to new plugin form, (3) Address serialization issues in workflow/sink layer, (4) Duplicate v1 as v2 package with necessary adaptations.
workaround: Users can create their own copy of the OTel interceptors for v2 support outside the official SDK.
keyQuote: The plan is therefore to make a _new_ package for this, something like `@temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry2`, so that both plugin versions can coexist.
